climbs.name: Riding the Cotton Pony
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Tom Burke

content.description: This is a good route, with only one really hard move past a bolt down low on the climb. The rest of the climb is 5.10-. This route climbs a very obvious orange stain left of the Good Book.
content.protection: One or two med cams at the start, and the rest is protected by bolts. The climb goes up to a 2 bolt rap anchor, which is just below the top.
content.location: Located on the south face of the upper bump on Saddle Rocks.

climbs.name: Hey McLeod, Get Off of My Ewe

content.description:
This climb is located on the right side of the highest part of Saddle Rocks, just right of the start to The Good Book. This is an excellent and beautiful aid route and is great practice with RURPs/copperheads without seriously risking one's neck, because there are a few "chicken" bolts along the thin crack to safeguard against any super long falls. The route starts as an easy slab/apron (5.5, 1 bolt), then hits a head wall. A thin seam/crack runs the length of the head wall, but doesn't quite reach the slab. Aid off a second bolt, and ascend the thin crack on RURPs, beaks, and/or copperheads. This crack is supplemented with 3 "chicken" bolts, so you probably won't wet your pants on this section. Please leave the chicken bolts in place.

After awhile, the crack opens up to take RPs, TCUs, and stoppers. Rappel off one bolt and a runner around a horn (single 60 mm. rope, 100').
content.protection: Quick Draws, RURPS and/or copperheads, beaks, RPs, and small cams, a few stoppers, maybe a KB or so.
content.location: Just right of The Good Book.

content.description: Climb "Crystal Calisthenics" to the ledge, then continue up the big left facing dihedral.
This sad climb goe up grainy, poor cracks and then up grainy loose face climbing. I don't normally like to give a climb "the bomb" but this one is deserving. I am sorry.
content.protection: A trad rack and some QDs for 2 bolts which protect face climbing.
content.location: Far right side of the So. face of Saddle Rock; almost at the top.

climbs.name: Crystal Calisthenics
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger, Charles Cole & Hank Levine, April 1978

content.description: Near the center of The South Face of the upper summit, climb a crack, to the left of a black streak. Move right  past a bolt to a dihedral, Follow this to a ledge. Climb up and left past a bolt to a crack and the top.
